reviews.review:
ストーリー性のあるアクションパズルゲーム。シングルキャンペーンをクリアしてのレビューです。

撃った場所２か所が空間的につながる不思議な銃ポータルガンを駆使して閉じ込められた部屋から脱出する頭脳ゲームの第２弾。本作からでもプレイできますが、前作で順を追って丁寧に説明されたテクニックをガンガン使っていくことになりますしストーリーもつながっているので、もし未プレイなら前作をプレイしておくことをお勧めします。

他にはない独特なパズルがとても楽しいゲームです。銃の機能を使うだけでなく、重力や慣性、機械や壁の配置、新ギミックの様々な装置などを駆使して難関を突破していきます。戦闘もありますがあくまでも頭脳で戦います。難易度もいきづまったと思ってもよく考えれば必ず解法が見つかる絶妙なバランス。探せば解法を紹介しているWebページなどもありますが見てしまうとたぶん面白さが半減します。もしかしてこんなことできるのか？と思ってやってみたら実行できて道が開けたりしますし、入口が閉じた場合には必ずそこから先のものを使って先に進めるようになっていて、パズルを解くうえで注目すべき場所には明かりを当てるなどの方法で目立つ工夫がなされているので、とにかくあきらめずにいろいろ試してみるのが楽しむコツだと思います。ストーリーもなかなかよくて特にラストが秀逸。前作を遊んでいると特に感慨深い思いにかられます。逆に前作をやっていないとわからない部分も多いかと思います。

協力プレイは少し試しただけですが、XBOXコントローラーを2つつないで画面分割で遊ぶことができるのでネットゲームが苦手な人でも友達を部屋に呼んで一緒に楽しめると思います（マルチプレイの画面まで進んで２つ目のコントローラのＸボタンを押せば画面分割プレイになります。設定画面で上下分割か左右分割かを変更できます）。1人で2つのコントローラーを使って遊べるかとも思いましたが、タイミングをとったりするのがかなり難しいので2人で遊ぶべきですね(^^;

外部ツール（tridefなど）で3D立体視可能です（自分のセッティングでは水面の反射がうまく立体化できませんでしたが映像の質を下げれば気にならないレベルになります）。エンディングがムービーで立体視できないのが少し残念でしたが、それ以外はゲーム中のイベントも含めて全て立体視で遊べます。

Webで解法などを探しててっとりばやくストーリーを進めたい人はあまり楽しめないかと思います。
頭脳を駆使して問題を解決していくことに楽しさを感じられる人に特にオススメします。
Tons of fun and lots of laughs had. No complaints here.

Recomendadisimo, tanto este, como el primero. Más largo (gracias), muchas más dinámicas (reutilizables), no de esas que solo se usan 1 vez y en el resto del juego no se vuelven a ver, apartir de cierto punto de la mitad del juego (no diré específicamente cual ya que sería spoiler) se aumenta el grado de dificultad en los puzzles, mas hermoso con todo y lo dificil; muy bien hecho, bonito visualmente, muy bien doblado (español, no he probado otro idioma). Resumiendo: Compraos el juego si teneís la oportunidad en Humble Bumble o en ofertas o como sea pero muy bueno. 
RECOMENDADISIMO

Where do I start here? Hmm...

This game has really cool scenery, a fantastic and very fitting soundtrack, puzzles that can make you feel stupid and clever at the same time, a lot of secrets, it's just beautiful. 

It was worth the money when it came out, and it's worth even more now.

Coop, The Infinite Testing initiative, the Free  Thinking With Time Machine  easy to install mod (with it's own infinite testing initiative).


This game also has an incredible mapmaking community, these people make new stories and concepts and whole series, some of which deserve to be thier own standalone mods. (You can get them right from the steam workshop with all the other infinite testing initiative stuff)

So in conclusion; Buy It Now.





TL;DR: Why haven't you thrown your money at it already?

Le premier Portal était déjà grandiose malgré une durée de vie minuscule (en 3 heures vous aviez bouclé le jeu) mais celui ci est ... je ne trouve même pas les mots ... PARFAIT ! Oui, c'est cela, parfait. Des graphismes extrêmement beaux, un gameplay dont seul Valve a le secret, une bande son VF tout simplement sublime avec des dialogues et des musiques envoutants. La durée de vie du jeu est suffisamment longue pour qu'on passe un moment formidable sur ce jeu qui a surement marqué l'histoire du jeu vidéo. En bref, si vous ne l'avez pas encore, achetez le immédiatement ! Vous avez raté votre vie si vous n'avez jamais touché à ce jeu ! Et je n'exagère pas. Portal 2 vous emmène dans son monde futuriste et fantastique, c'est un chef d’œuvre. Pour finir, je vous informe que la version console est très jouable, je n'ai eu aucun mal à tirer des portails là où il fallait, même dans les coins les plus hards du jeu ^^ vous pouvez donc l'acheter tranquille :)
in case of explosion look directly into it!

One of the best games I have ever played

If I had to give Portal 2 a score between 1-100, then it would be 999999>

This game has got a lot of funny moments and a good plot that tells you the story, without spoiling too much. Maybe the biggest spoiler in the game was a turret.

For the music; almost perfect, but sometimes a bit too electric. I liked the fact that the music changed with your actions, your location and plot. I don't see that often in games (if they already have music that fits). I.E; it intensifies when you're defeating the boss and it changes when you use the blue gel or if you kill a turret.

The gels are an amazing addition that really adds a new element to the game. Now you don't have only need to think with portals, but also with speed, fysics and bouncyness.
And when you're in co-op modus, you have to think with portals twice as much as in singleplayer.
Don't forget about the perpetual testing initiative! Since Portal have got an end, and after palying the game more times, you know how to solve the puzzles. But in Portal 2, you can use the maps of the community. And if you want to, you can make your own (like I did).

The detaillness of the maps where amazing. You can spilt Portal 2 in 6 parts and every part has got its own properties. For instance, when you're playing in the underground, you see that everything is falling apart due to a lack of maintenance. You also hear that. The soundscape fits amazingly well!

Shortly;
If you're hesistating, buy it. Portal 2 is worth it. It's even more worth it when it's on sale.

What to say abour portal 2 that hasn't been said before. It's an awesome game, you get to play with portals, explore apature science deep dark past. Sadly no lemons that explode and burn down lifes house. It's short, but the steam work shop makes up for that. So go grab this game, play with portals oh and watch out for the mantis soldiers.

Portal 2, Portal 2...where do I begin? Well, a friend of mine, of whom is a big fan of this game, suggested it to me. Not being a big videogamer, I was hesitant and opted to watch a 2 hour playthrough of it on YouTube, just to see if it was my kind of thing. This game is AMAZING. It's very easy to see why it has so many positive reviews. Admittedly, buying this game was the sole reason I joined Steam in the first place. Though I promise not to spoil any of the plot for anyone reading this before having played the game.

The one thing I tend to look for it any videogame is a good plot. For me, it's what keeps me playing. And heck does this game deliver in that sense. I admit, I've never played the first Portal, as I did some research and found that there wasn't much plot other than 'do the tests, kill GLaDOS'. However, its' sequel has a really interesting ongoing plot. Even when you're doing GLaDOS' tests, Wheatley will often pop out of the panels with an encouraging "Just hold on for a few more tests, then we'll break out of here!" Though I have to admit, I've never had a videogame plot give me so many feels before. When it gets to the point when you feel sympathy for the antagonist before you're about to destroy them, you know it's a quality game. 

However, every plot needs good characters, and Portal 2 had a surplus of those. As is the same for the first game, Ellen McLain voices GLaDOS, the cynical, sarcastic and very sadistic AI that is obsessed with testing. I know they obviously used a lot of autotuning to make GLaDOS sound like a machine, but I still think Ellen McLain's monotonous voice carries the character very well. Now that GLaDOS has some history with Chell (mainly of Chell 'killing' her), it is absolutely hilarious hearing that AI hold a grudge. Some of those lines are just brilliant. 
"Oh, it's YOU. How have you been? I've been a bit busy being dead. You know, after you MURDERED ME."
The AI's attempt to insult Chell during testing also has me cracking up.

The second main character in this game is, of course, Wheatley. Steven Merchant does Wheatley's character such justice. Wheatley is your lovable, kind of moronic, sidekick in the game. It's worth it during gameplay to just stop what you are doing to listen to his quality lines. He isn't completely useless, though. Often, Wheatley will help you navigate through the Aperature Science facility. After all, the place is massive, so getting lost could be quite easy without him as your guide. The fact that he also has a built-in torch inside of his optic is also very useful.
"Aaah! Oh. Oh, they told me, that if I ever turned this thing on, I would DIE. They told me that about everything! I don't know why they bothered giving me these things if they didn't want me to use them!"

The last of the main characters in this game, is of course, Chell. She is the character you play in the game. I really like her because, despite the fact that she is in fact female (which I've seen is pretty rare in videogames nowadays, especially females that aren't sexualised in someway, which Chell is NOT, thankfully), she is also totally mute. She can't-or won't-speak at all in the game, but still manages to totally kick robot butt.

There are other characters in this game, but they are only present through various voice recordings throughout the old Aperture Science Testing Facility. These characters are Cave Johnson, the (rather arrogant) creator of Aperature Science, and Caroline, his (overly enthusiastic) assisant. Both characters, though they don't play very big roles as they are, help the player get an insight to what Aperature Science used to be like before everything went downhill and GLaDOS went rogue.

Another thing that I find useful in a good videogame is a quality soundtrack. I have to admit, during gameplay, there really isn't that much of it, other than to create ambience during the 'epic' parts of plot or during the boss battle. Otherwise, I find the testing areas pretty quiet and found myself popping in my headphones during those parts. The credits song was amazing, though. Just like the first game's credit song, it was sung by Ellen McLain as GLaDOS and is sung (rather sarcastically in parts) to, presumably, Chell. It's called 'Want You Gone' and I tend to listen to it a lot due to it's greatness. XD
There is also another ending song, sung by the Turrets at the very end. It is an Opera-style song sung in what I assume to be Italian. It does sound great, though.

And finally, we get to the gameplay itself. I don't really have any complaints when playing it, myself. (Just as a side note, I'm not referring to the Co-op part of the game, as I've only ever played the single player game.) Sure, the tests can get a bit repetitive, but the plot usually furthers before you can get fed up with it. The tests, thankfully, are never too mind numbingly difficult. Sure, they are really challenging and it may take you a while to figure them out, but all of them are do-able, even for a gaming newbie like me. And, let's be honest, ripping holes into reality was never going to be boring.

Overall, I 100% reccommend this to anybody, veteran gamer or otherwise. It was highly enjoyable and is guarenteed to be replayed again and again. I know I'm going to be replaying as soon as I finish writing this review. :)

Una GRAN secuela de Portal donde nos explica otro mensaje: Todos somos libres!.
Esta historia ocurre 27 años despues de lo ocurrido con HL, porque Portal se ambienta durante la guerra de las 7 horas donde desconectas a GLADOS y te vuelven a meter en una "sala" de sujetos de prueba.
Ya pasando de la ambientación y entrando un poco mas en lo técnico del juego: Tiene un sistema gráfico bastante aceptable por estos años a pesar de que ya es medio viejo el juego y para ese tiempo fue como un boom, con una banda sonora bastante pegadiza, con una historia en la que infieres a través de la narrativa visual lo cual se asemeja a Portal y a los Bioshock donde sin que te digan nada entiendes la historia por medio de la narrativa visual, con jugabilidad muy simple pero muy buena y un sistema de ports "aceptable".
Amazingly amazing ! Great concept, great gameplay, and great cinematography. Puzzzzlllees !  Dont often give 5 stars, but this one is 5/5

I was recommended to check this game out by a few people and as a person who usually sucks at puzzle games, I didn't think I'd like it. Turns out I was wrong. I picked this game up as a combo sale with it's predesessor and I am truly glad I did. The graphics, puzzles, and design are great but it's the humor that knocks it out of the park for me. Good thing it's much longer than the first Portal and it weaves and interesting narrotive as a result. If you like puzzles, an interesting story, and a good laugh, don't hesitate to check this one out!

En başta tamamen özgün bir oyun. Karakterler çok iyi oturtulmuş, diyaloglar gerçekten çok iyi. Oyunda Türkçe arayüz ve altyazı desteği olması da ayrıca bir avantaj. 

Bu oyunu olumsuz olarak oylayan kişinin bu yorumu oyuna değil kesinlikle oyun türünedir diye düşünüyorum fakat bu oyun öyle "bulmaca" denilerek geçilebilecek bir oyun da değil aslında, en başta da söylediğim gibi kesinlikle özgün bir yapıt. 

Birçok farklı türde birçok farklı oyun bitirdim ama bitirdikten sonra, gerçek anlamda "keşke daha uzun olsaydı" dediğim tek oyun bu oldu. İçerik hakkında fazla detaylı yorum yapmayı istemiyorum, video oyunlarıyla haşır neşir olan herkesin mutlaka oynaması gerekir derim. Serinin ilk oyunu, kalitesiz olmasa da beni bunun kadar fazla etkileyemedi ama yine de senaryo bütünlüğü açısından ilk olarak onu bitirmenizde yarar var.

Mira que me gustó Portal, de hecho sigue siendo uno de mis juegos favoritos, pero el 2... se come con patatas a Portal 1. Lo primero, la historia. La historia en Portal es interesante pero en Portal 2 es mucho más profunda, no quiero hacer spoilers. La historia es algo indescriptible. Lo segundo son los nuevos objetos que te da Aperture Science cómo los cubos de desviación del láser, los puentes de luz etc. Lo tercero es la libertad dónde puedes poner portales. Tienes más libertad para ponerlos. Ya por último, es un detallito. Hay una parte de Aperture Science que me recuerda mucho a Rapture ciudad de Bioshock y Bioshock 2. Ahí lo dejo. La única cosa mala del juego son los tiempos de carga es horrrible, pero merece la pena. Eso sí, no vayáis a por el 2 directamente. Comprad el 1 y disfrutad, pero el 2 os va a dejar con la boca abierta. Os deseo que disfrutéis el juego y la saga en general.
Fun game, but sometimes frustrating.
